Description: Head of female terracotta figure with hair arranged in 'melon style', following Tanagra types. Mould-made and solid. Broken at neck. Traces of white coating on neck and red paint on hair. Fine red-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at Naukratis terracottas workshop that was operational between the 3rd to 2nd century BC and possibly later. Parallels from Egypt include early 3rd century BC (Török 1995, pl.114, no.21) and 3rd century example (Fischer 1994, no.104), see also early 2nd century BC example (Bayer-Niemeier 1988, pl.2.6, no.12). Naukratis parallels, both NA542 and NA547 are similar to Ptolemaic examples from Memphis (Petrie 1909, pl.30. 97; Petrie 1910, pl.44.155) for hairstyle. Gutch dates this type to the 2nd century BC (Gutch in Hogarth 1898-9, 85, no.88). Bayer-Niemeier, E. 1988. Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1.
